title: 112_hr3351
content: The Act titled "Franchise Education for Veterans Act" allows the use of educational assistance for franchise training. The GI Bill now includes various training programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training at approved establishments for franchises. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable for such programs. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable for such programs. The amount of educational assistance for a training program at a specified establishment is based on fees assessed and a monthly housing stipend. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments with limitations on educational assistance. The assistance includes a monthly housing stipend and a stipend for books, supplies, and equipment. The number of months of entitlement for a training program is based on the total amount of educational assistance paid to the individual. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments with limitations on educational assistance, including a monthly housing stipend and stipend for books, supplies, and equipment. The number of months of entitlement for a training program is determined by dividing the total educational assistance paid to the individual by the full-time monthly institutional rate. Payment of educational assistance for training programs cannot exceed the individual's available entitlement under the chapter. The subsection for training programs under the GI Bill sets limits on educational assistance based on available entitlement. Veterans are capped at 12 months of assistance and $15,000 total. Adjustments are made for individuals not covered under specific sections. Payment for training programs is made to the individual upon the Secretary receiving the necessary information. Payment for training programs under paragraph (3)(E) of the Post-9/11 GI Bill is made to the individual upon the Secretary receiving a certification of enrollment from the training establishment.
